Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a pale-red pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and grey in section, the exterior is covered with a burnished red-brown slip and remains of seven lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (370769) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/370769)
Exhibition history: 2023-2024 13 Nov-3 Mar, New York, Metropolitan Museum, Africa and Byzantium
